result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin M. Bombagi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.
No contact with J.G.

Enroll in and successfully complete AODA treatment and domestic violence treatment. Complete any other assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin M. Bombagi

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:05am
INCLUDES 12CF71, 13CM241, 15CM598
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty James Kurszewski
Date and time set for sentencing hearing in 15CM598 & SAR in 12CF71 & 13CM241

State says all parties have received PSI and SAR packets
Atty Kurszewski has received both PSI and SAR packets and does not have any corrections to either
Atty Kurszewski provides to court information on status of defendant's rehabilitation while in custody
State makes argument on sentencing
Atty Kurszewski makes argument on sentencing
Defendant makes statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 12CF71 Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine: 3 and half years WSPS- 1 and a half years IC, 2 years ES. 339 days credit granted. 13CM241 Ct. 1 Battery-repeater-domestic abuse: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. 260 days credit granted. 15CM598 Ct. 1 Battery-repeater-domestic abuse: 2 years WSPS- 1 year IC, 1 year ES. All three sentences to be consecutive to each other. Totalling 3 and half years IC, 4 years ES. CONDITIONS: Deft is not eligible for either prison programming- Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. No contact with victim- J.G. Enroll and successfully complete AODA treatment and domestic violence treatment. Complete any other assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

State and Atty Kurszewski are to maintain PSI in confidential manner.
Deft is remanded to MC Sherriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge Prison
Adj: 9:49am

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
includes 12CF71, 13CM241, 15CM598
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 9:31am
INCLUDES 15CM598, 12CF71, & 13CM241
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty James Kurszewski

State says hearing for plea in 15CM598 and SAR in 12CF71 & 13CM241

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
15CM598:
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct - repeater - domestic abuse >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
15CM598:
Ct. 1 Battery - repeater - domestic abuse >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: PSI report in all three files - 12CF71, 13CM241, and 15CM598

CC: 01/11/16 at 1:00pm Br 1 JA

Adj: 9:40am

Pre-trial conference at 09-02-2015 03:10 pm.
Final pre-trial at 10-13-2015 08:30 am.
Jury Trial at 11-03-2015 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): J.G.-NON WAIVABLE. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
